column4: I had added a PPA source via terminal (pmcenery for iphone stuff) and after perusing the other stuff, decided to remove the source.  I removed it from Software Sources and no dice.  I then deleted the two pmcenery files from /etc/apt/sources.list.d and it STILL shows up in Software Center
reinstall the ppa, then use ppa-purge to remove it; it will pin the old versions and downgrade for you, by default no package manager will offer a downgrade
it'd be in the same format as you'd use with apt-add-repository; which is listed on the launchpad ppa page
